title: Steamed Salmon Parcels

ingredients.content: 4 fresh salmon fillets, thick cut, boneless (approx. 150 g each)
20 g fresh root ginger, peeled, cut in round slices (2 mm)
1 small handful fresh coriander leaves (approx. 5 g)
3 fresh green chillies, halved, deseeded if desired

preparations.content: Mix lime juice, salt and turmeric together in a large dish. Add salmon fillets and rub all over with marinade. Set aside for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare spice paste.

Place all spice paste ingredients in mixing bowl and blend <b>5 sec/speed 8<b>. Divide spice paste evenly between fish fillets in dish forming a layer on top. Cut four squares of greaseproof paper, large enough to wrap each fish fillet in. Place each fillet with spice paste on a square and wrap to form a parcel then place in Varoma dish.
Place water in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and weigh in rice. Rinse <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>.
Place covered Varoma into position and steam fish above rice <b>19 min/Varoma/speed 4<b>. Serve rice with salmon still in their parcels.

hintsAndTricks: Wear gloves when rubbing marinade into fish to avoid dyeing your hands with turmeric.

If you were to create these Gujarati parcels authentically you’d wrap them in banana leaves, but greaseproof paper does the job just as well. The fish, encased in a fresh and zingy spice paste, will stay beautifully tender and moist by steaming as well as retain all the flavour of the marinade thanks to the paper parcels.
Fresh coconut flesh can be used in place of desiccated coconut. Add fresh coconut, cut in pieces, with other spice paste ingredients and blend <b>15 sec/speed 8<b> in step 2.
